titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [November 1944]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 179; deutsch: Briefe, S. 220; Cambridge Letters, S. 318; WiC, S. 369).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: I was sorry to hear in the Moral Sc. Club on Saturday that you were resigning your Chairmanship. It wasn't really necessary to resign it as I could always have deputized for you whenever you didn't feel inclined or able to come. â€’ I was, as you can imagine, elected chairman after your letter had been read to the Club. I hope this doesn't mean that you aren't going to come to the meetings when your health will again permit it (& some moderately interesting person reads a paper). I should very much like to see you before long if it's all right with you.
